channel.title: Recent posts to Link on website for AIX
channel.description: Recent posts to Link on website for AIX

item.title: Link on website for AIX
item.description:
Maybe it does. Seems that there are at least three websites that provide xz package for AIX though, and I have no clue how good they are (and it may depend on user's preferences or needs too). AIXTOOLS, Bull, and Perzl all have xz packages. At the moment only AIXTOOLS has the latest version. Should I link to all three sites? Are there other sites than those three?

On the other hand, don't AIX users know about these websites already and thus would look for a package from them before looking at the upstream website? On the yet another hand, linking to such sites from upstream page can still be somewhat useful.

If I add links, I should sometimes check that the links are still alright. :-) I just checked the Mac OS X link I had and that page was no longer up to date. For that OS there are other source like Homebrew that are up to date, so I removed that section from the xz home page.
item.dc:creator: Lasse Collin

item.title: Link on website for AIX
item.description:
Hi.

Hi. I think AIX fits the category for “hard to get” and I would appreciate a link to

http://www.aixtools.net/index.php/xz

Thanks!
item.dc:creator: Michael Felt
